website_summaries.verdict: There's a reason this seat has been on the market more than 100 years. Expect some break-in time, but after that, it's amazingly comfortable.
pros: A harder saddle that's ideal for long-distance sports touring, trekking, and MTB use
Steel rails with vegetable-tanned leather cover
Hard at first, but over time, it breaks in for excellent comfort and support
cons: Comes with a break-in period for most riders, but is worth the initial minimal discomfort

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and looks great
customer_reviews.text: The B17 Special is just as comfortable to me as my old saddle, a Team Pro Imperial. I wanted copper rivets but Brooks does not currently make an Imperial cut saddle with copper rivets. The B17 Special on right is flatter on top, flares out to the sides more, and sits a little higher than the Team Pro Imperial on left. The leather is initially very dry and will soak up the first application of Proofide. Compare the darker treated area to the lighter dry area. It is easier to apply the first treatment of Proofide before you put the saddle on your bicycle. The frame is copper plated except the nose piece.
customer_reviews.author: Nature Calls

customer_reviews.title: I Just Sit Down and Ride
customer_reviews.text: The best compliment one could make about a saddle is that they never think about it. Such is the case with this one. I put it on my bike and have never thought about it since . What I mean is that I no longer feel the need to shift my weight a little this way or that way after the ten mile mark. I no longer notice any soreness or tenderness. It's like breathing. When you are healthy, you don't even realize you are doing it. That's the best way to describe my experience these first three months. I just sit down and ride. My back, on the other hand...I think about that all the time.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis the Menace

customer_reviews.title: On the fence.
customer_reviews.text: I have it 3 stars because I'm not sure what to think about this saddle. I read many many reviews and I understand that it can take hundreds of hours before it even begins to feel comfortable. I honestly just don't feel like I want to wait. The seat can feel so uncomfortable at first, that it's hard to imagine it getting any better. Like I said, even it they say it feels like sitting on a cloud later on, I just don't see it happening for me. Sorry Brooks. Maybe I'll put it back on my bike at some point and try again.
customer_reviews.author: P.V.

customer_reviews.title: Immediately comfortable, gets better every day
customer_reviews.text: This is my first Brooks saddle, and like most people, I was worried about this so-called "break-in period." Imagine my surprise when the first time I sat on it it felt incredibly comfortable and better than any other saddle I've owned. It also felt very slippery which I did not like at first, but I'm happy to say that after ~100 miles it was either not slippery anymore due to friction/wear, or my body adjusted to it. Either way, don't even notice it being slippery anymore. I've put ~300 miles on this so far and I love it more and more every day. And I don't need to wear bike shorts anymore!
customer_reviews.author: Max

customer_reviews.title: Going to have to make small modifications to avoid thigh rub from saddle flare over time.
customer_reviews.text: I had to order a heavy-duty hole puncher, and punch 8 holes (4 on each side) below the B17 logo, and lace some para cord through the saddle to prevent flare out. I got the idea from Brooks themselves, considering the pre-aged saddle my friend got has holes punched in it, and leather lacing it up. Would give 5 stars, but for the price, and consideration that I had to self mod it to keep it functional it gets docked 1.
customer_reviews.author: Stonebrew

customer_reviews.title: Wow.
customer_reviews.text: After years of seeking, and hundreds of dollars spent, I had begun to adopt the belief that there actually is no such thing as a truly comfortable bicycle seat. Then I found the B17. It really is incredible how much of an improvement it is even on my Bontrager and my Selle Italia. I felt the difference immediately, as soon as I sat down for my first ride with it. Buy with confidence.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Carbone

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected
customer_reviews.text: Everyone raves about the Brooks Saddle but I was skeptical. How could a hard piece of leather be more comfortable than a padded seat. When I received the saddle, I had just finished a 40 mile ride. The saddle came in a quality box, much like a gift box. I installed it and went for a quick ride. My bottom was pleased. The ride I made prior to installing the Brooks left me sore, but I felt rejuvenated and very comfortable. I have put on only 100 miles so far. I'm told 500 to 1000 will break it in. Already feels broken in. I love it!
customer_reviews.author: T. R.

customer_reviews.title: You've gotta break it in.
customer_reviews.text: The twenty-five year old seat on my main touring bike finally tore, making it unusable. A number of others on my touring rides have recommended the Brooks saddles, saying that the only caveat is the first fifty or so miles of discomfort while breaking it in. I installed the seat just before a three hundred mile tour, and sure enough, by the second day, the seat had molded to fit my posterior and by the third day I completely forgot it was there. This thing truly is comfortable and only more miles will tell if it stands the test of time!
customer_reviews.author: A. Case

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and very long lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have two B17 imperials. 2,000+ mi on each of them. Hands down the most comfortable saddle I've ever owned. Heavy? Yes (duh they're leather and steel). But über comfortable and they help take some shocks and jolts out of a ride. I personally did not experience pain during the break in, but another user might. It took longer on my hardtail because I was standing up and moving more than on my gravel rig. My sole complaint? It's got a reaaaally wiiiiiide tail end, makes it hard to get my weight back over the rear wheel on my hardtail, even with a dropper (self inflicted thing to complain about but still).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Breaker of asses until it molds to you
customer_reviews.text: Pretty easy to install and adjust if you work on your own bike. It's pretty thick leather so there's some break-in period, however, once broken in it feels great. Break-in time varies by person of course and there are many factors that lead to faster break-in's but trust that your leather saddle will feel great once the hard work is done. I used the Brooks-branded conditioner on my saddle during break-in. Can't say that it sped process up but it protects the leather and smells great.
customer_reviews.author: Enrique L.

customer_reviews.title: I got an amazing deal! on best seat ever!
customer_reviews.text: First, I haven't tried tons and tons of different seats, but i can say for certain that this is leaps and bounds better than my old crappy seat. Yes, the break in period can break you, but the comfort after, and even occasionally during, is top notch. A seat that will last for many years across many different bikes. I got a GREAT deal cause it was listed as a women's seat, though it was clearly a man's in the picture. I guess no one else was willing to gamble. I did. It paid off! I'm not even sure i could have bought it wholesale at this price and yes it's genuine.
customer_reviews.author: R. Houdek

customer_reviews.title: Best saddle if you stick with it.
customer_reviews.text: My 27-year-old bike was recently stolen, and the thing that hurt most about it (literally) was that my 27-year-old broken-in Brooks leather saddle was lost with it. I got a new bike with one of those fancy modern saddles, but felt pretty quickly that it just wasn’t going to do it for my spoiled behind... so I got this new one, and while it’s not yet anywhere near the comfort level I’m used to, it’s nice to know that eventually I’ll be able to ride again without worrying about not being able to sit for a while!
customer_reviews.author: Minnie

customer_reviews.title: Apple Green Saddle looks Amazing!!!
customer_reviews.text: There are lots of reviews about the quality of Brooks seats, so let me stick to the color. I really hesitated on the green, because i thought it might look garish on my bike, a vintage Schwinn Super Sport with metallic green paint and a gorgeous patina....but how is a bright green, brand-new saddle going to look...? In a word, GREAT! The folks at Brooks know how to get just the right look to stick with the classy, old-time look, even with a fun color like this. I can't wait to see how it's going to look in 5 or 10 years!
customer_reviews.author: arunan

customer_reviews.title: Most comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Absolute perfection. Reeks quality out of the package. I wasted money and pain on others before my sore butt communicated with my brain and told it to get the real thing, like I had decades ago. With Proofide liberally applied on the underside, the saddle has broken in comfort-wise in just a couple hundred miles. Later, I'm sure it will further mold for rides over thirty miles.
customer_reviews.author: Larry

customer_reviews.title: A classic comforable seat
customer_reviews.text: This is my 4th Brooks bike seat. All are comfortable and easy to install. Many of the ultra sleek bike seats have very little access between the bottom of the seat and the seat rails. This makes installation problematic. But the Brooks is well designed with adequate room to manipulate the seat bolts & nuts with your hands. If weight is your primary concern vs. comfort. then go elsewhere. I value comfort to a higher degree than the mass of the bike parts as i am not a racer.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Millhouse

customer_reviews.title: Brooks B17 saddle is the best
customer_reviews.text: This saddle is the solution to your sore butt. I love cycle touring, but have struggled with saddle soreness on rides over 40 miles in a day. The Brooks B17 saddle was more comfortable from the first time I sat on it. I purchased the Aged Tan Saddle and it is perfect. I am 5-10, 185 pounds, not a stick figure of a cyclist. This is an extremely well constructed, handsome, classic design. I now can enjoy cycle touring at a new level. No more concern about the last ten miles of a 50 mile leg of a tour. Buy one today- you will not regret the extra money spent on this fabulous saddle
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: Best available
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brooks saddle. The original lasted 21 years and approximately 100,000 miles. Yeah, I'm addicted to bicycling in a big way - it's called "Hypergymnasia" - Google it. I wouldn't recommend any other brand for comfort (after you endure the literal PITA of breaking it in, anyway) and durability. Totally worth it! If I live long enough to wear THIS one out, I'll get a third.
customer_reviews.author: jpooch00

customer_reviews.title: Superb comfort, great look!
customer_reviews.text: I never write reviews, but I’m already blown away by this saddle. I’m pretty new to serious riding. I’ve always been impressed by endurance cyclists, so I figured I’d start trying to do that while being quarantined. I got the Giant Escape 3 disc. I put about 100 miles on the stock seat in 15-25 mile increments. After each ride my bum felt like I sat on a 2x4 for hours. I tried this saddle yesterday and today, 10 miles each day, and I already notice I huge difference. I feel like I could probably do 50 miles before I’d notice the saddle is even there. I highly recommend!! P.S. (it looks incredible as well)
customer_reviews.author: Steven Anderson

customer_reviews.title: My butt is finally happy
customer_reviews.text: I tried several saddles for my Trek road bike, I even had the bike set up professionally. However I continued to get a sore butt after 10 miles or so. This really took the fun out of cycling as I wanted to work my way up to a half century ride. A few people said that the Brooks saddles got really comfy after awhile, awhile being 800 miles by one person. I cringed at the idea of such a long breaking in period but then discovered the Imperial, with the cut-out section. Surprisingly, this saddle felt great right out of the box!! Wow, my dreams come true. It sure is working for me, hope the same becomes true for you!!
customer_reviews.author: jaysee

customer_reviews.title: Hubby's favorite saddle
customer_reviews.text: We have Brooks Saddles on all our bikes. The B17 is a classic. They do take a while to break in, but since we ride with padded cycling shorts, it isn't as big a deal as if you just ride in regular shorts. The leather is going to be stiffer than a padded seat. However, once you get some miles on these seats they are super. I just put a sprung version on our tandem as the stoker seat.
customer_reviews.author: Krista G

customer_reviews.title: Reviews are legit. No more pain on long rides!
customer_reviews.text: It takes some breaking in, but the positive reviews are right on this one. I used to think that dealing with pain was just part of riding longer 50 miles and when getting back on I'd just fight the pain until I went numb. Now that my Brooks has miles on it (600+ mi), I was able to spend 14 hours on the bike and rode almost 120 miles in one day (a personal best). I was tired, but no pain. And the next day I felt like I could get back on. Really am impressed!
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Harbert

customer_reviews.title: Laughably small amount of Proofide
customer_reviews.text: You have to wonder if Brooks could have put any less of the stuff in the envelope. It is not enough accomplish the job, and they know it. Rather than give in and buy more Proofide -- which we are solemnly told is the only substance that should be used on Brooks saddles-- from Brooks, I am just going to return the saddle on principle.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Ekbaum

customer_reviews.title: Awesome saddle
customer_reviews.text: This is not my first B17 but it is my first one with a cutout. I still don't have it all the way broken in but it's a well-made, good-looking saddle and it's getting more comfortable every week. I like that (since my last one) Brooks has added holes that you can lace underneath to preserve the saddle's shape as it wears.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Tramel

customer_reviews.title: for any one that wants the most comfortable saddle on earth.
customer_reviews.text: one very fantastic comfortable beautiful leather saddle. got 2,800 miles on it so far it has become more and more comfortable. i ride 6,000miles a year. My bike is my car .that must have a great seat .note u must run fenders and cover when it rain's to keep these saddle's looks great.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan

customer_reviews.title: Break it in, don’t get it wet.
customer_reviews.text: This is my fourth Brooks saddle - every bike I buy gets one. In this case, I am equipping my Brompton for a week of touring and got a new seat to break in before I go. So far I’ve got about 100 miles on it and it’s finally starting to get comfortable. This is really the only saddle for serious cyclists.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Bowen

customer_reviews.title: High quality, high price, high maintenance
customer_reviews.text: Great material obviously and very good look however for the price if you’re looking for a good comfortable seat then I recommend something else for the money. But if you’re looking for a speak look with high quality then this is the right seat for you. It will be hard and somewhat uncomfortable until broken in since it is a very hard molded leather. Make sure to use the leather wax provided and maybe buy more for the future to help it mold to your butt crack.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say: The Brooks reputation is well deserved. I cycle commute about 20 miles to and from work every day, with the occasional 100 Miler Weekend. I've probably tried dozen's of saddles over the years, and the B17 remains my favorite. For the record the real leather saddle does require some maintenance, protective care and in our hot and wet Southern climate, needs to be covered and dried slowly if exposed to frequent rain. Nonetheless, your backside will thank you for the extra effort.
customer_reviews.author: Ocean Gypsy

customer_reviews.title: Poor long term support
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this saddle after purchasing original B17. B17 is still in good condition. After approx 4,000 miles (4-5 months of riding) this B17 Imperial Saddle has completely collapsed on both sides of the split. It was never wet and laces were used. Completely disappointed in this saddle but still impressed with the original B17. Maybe this saddle is simply made for small riders (I am 6'1" 185lb). Will stick with original B17s from now on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I wont be immediately comfortable and it requires maintenance.
customer_reviews.text: So what I like about this saddle is its heritage and style. Owning it makes you feel important and well to do. Other people will compliment you on your style and who doesn't like that. I'm a bit different than others because i like keeping up on maintaining things i own. This saddle does require a bit of care and tuning. Buyer beware of that.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Best saddle I've ever owned.
customer_reviews.text: After having tried a few different premium saddles throughout my 15 years of cycling, this Brooks saddle without a question is the most comfortable and stylish bike saddle I've ever owned. I used to race in criteriums and was very conscious about the weight of every component on my bike. As the years of passed, I am more interested in not only the performance of a product but the comfort of it. As I stated earlier, this is by far the best bike saddle ever owned. I bought one of the saddles for my single speed bike, and bought this one for my road bike. Truly a five star product!
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Saddles are the most comfortable Avaiable.
customer_reviews.text: Brooks leather saddles are the most comfortable you will ever own. They are heavier than other saddles, but the trade for comfort is well worth it. These saddles need more TLC maintenance than synthetic (petrochemical-based) but will last longer with proper maintenance. If you are into competitive riding you may not need the comfort, as you probably won't be seating on it anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Bike Saddle
customer_reviews.text: Comfort - i did a short ride and it feels comfy and wide, which make my riding fun. Well built, quality leather, and you can just feel happy with the purchase just by looking on it. Classic well built bike saddle. Expensive but worth every penny. Reviews are pretty accurate about it.
customer_reviews.author: Marnie

customer_reviews.title: much better than saddle that came on bike and for me ...
customer_reviews.text: Third different seat. Had Cloud 9, much better than saddle that came on bike and for me this is even better. Close to 150 miles on Brooks saddle now and so really liking this saddle. Yes, hard and slick when new, but having to break in horse saddle many years ago knew I had to work through break in period. For me, well worth it. Did 30 miles yesterday and can tell it will be great for adventure biking on long trips
customer_reviews.author: K.L.F.

customer_reviews.title: Some things that were near perfect in those days have changed
customer_reviews.text: I rode on Brooks saddles back in the day when I was a serious cyclist. I had to set cycling aside for twenty years for family reasons, and am just restarting. First upgrade to new bicycle was a Brooks Imperial. Some things that were near perfect in those days have changed, not necessarily for the better. Some have not changed, and deliver the same experience they used to. Thank goodness Brooks has not changed.
customer_reviews.author: D. Earls

customer_reviews.title: Best Saddle ever - no breakin discomfort!
customer_reviews.text: I rode a Brooks saddle many years ago (late 70s) while stationed in Germany, but sold it with that bike. I've been reluctant to get another due to the breakin horror stories. I finally brought the classic 17 and it's great! Used all the proofide that came with it before installing. Took a short 30 mile ride yesterday and there was no discomfort at all. Took a 55 mile ride today - again, no discomfort! I'm sold - wish I'd gotten this saddle years ago!
customer_reviews.author: Jim

customer_reviews.title: Excellent, easily the most comfortable bike seat I've ever ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent, easily the most comfortable bike seat I've ever owned. Started good and is only getting better as it breaks in. Once a week smear it up with a generous amount of Proofide inside and out to break it in faster.
customer_reviews.author: Jamieson

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but it's not for me.
customer_reviews.text: Aesthetically it's great. It is truly a beautiful saddle. They say there is a break in period. I found it so slippery and uncomfortable that I couldn't manage to put in more than a couple rides before giving up on it completely. I spent more time thinking about my rear and struggling to keep it on the saddle than enjoying the ride. I have a C17 Cambium cut-out I've been riding for about four months and it is by far the most comfortable saddle I've ever ridden. I bought the B17 narrow after all the praise I've heard, but it didn't really work for me.
customer_reviews.author: A. Miller

customer_reviews.title: It just gets Better with every ride.
customer_reviews.text: . Excellent quality and ride comfort is amazing. This is my first Brooks Saddle and I have nothing but accolades for this saddle. Highly recommend this for any cyclist, I have over 700 miles on this saddle and including a century ride and never had numbness or a sore backside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nothing is better than a well-conditioned leather bike saddle
customer_reviews.text: I'm old school - been riding leather saddles for over 50 years, and Brooks' are the best. I like the B17 Narrow profile because it doesn't rub my legs, but the rear part provides good perch support. I have a couple of these and a couple of B17 standards now. Both Narrows came with very stiff leather, which I expect means they will last a long time, I Proofided them well before starting the riding part of the break-in, but they seemed reluctant to yield. Leather Honey helped to move the break-in process along. Both Narrows have several hundred miles on them now and are starting to yield ...it's a process, but well worth the effort.
customer_reviews.author: tio pablito

customer_reviews.title: to end up with a leather (gorgeous by the way) saddle that feels like plastic. I have no clue how it works
customer_reviews.text: I am stunned...I tried several high end saddles from Selle (Pro, Plus), Prologo and Specialized, to end up with a leather (gorgeous by the way) saddle that feels like plastic. I have no clue how it works, but I love it. 6'5", 250 lbs male.
customer_reviews.author: PickyBuyer

customer_reviews.title: It worked for me
customer_reviews.text: I have about 5,500 miles on my Brooks B-17 so far. It’s good enough where I don’t feel the need to keep searching for a good seat, but it’s not perfect, but maybe no seat is perfect after 60 miles day after day after day on a bike tour. I am not sure. Someday I might try the Brooks B-17 Imperial to see if the cutout helps with pressure and numbness for long days. But I don’t get that all the time.
customer_reviews.author: blue42

customer_reviews.title: Please follow instructions.
customer_reviews.text: Great saddle. Very high quality. The saddle is hard, but be patient, I did order additional Brooks profit cream with a saddle. I did apply a cream Brooks profit all top and undre saddle. I need ride around 800 miles on my saddle and the saddle will be soft and exactly for my butt.
customer_reviews.author: Olejka

customer_reviews.title: Lucky I shipped it directly to him
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my son who loves to ride. I have ridden his road bike with this saddle on it and it is very nice. Great looking in the brown leather. If I would have shipped this to my house he never would have got it as a gift. I have a Brooks Cambium and I like it fine, I just like the leather saddle a little more.
customer_reviews.author: L. Smart

customer_reviews.title: One of the best bicycle seats for comfort
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd Brooks B17 Seat. They're a little heavy, but worth it. For me they're pretty comfortable right from the start and then get better with mileage. I try to be careful to not get it wet and cover it when traveling on the bike rack, etc.
customer_reviews.author: D. Jackson

customer_reviews.title: $100. well spent
customer_reviews.text: This saddle is worth every penny of the $100 bucks it cost. Super comfortable. I have this particular saddle of 2 of my classic bike, although I think the aesthetics would clash with my more contemporary racing cycles. If you want a comfy saddle for a reasonable price, this is a great option. Highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: David R. Pierce

customer_reviews.title: My back has finaly found a piece
customer_reviews.text: After more than 14 years of experimenting with different seats I finally decided to buy this saddle (B17) for my road bike. What a relief! Now I can focus on my position on the bike and control my body way better and do not think about PAIN. It works fine for high and low riding position. I am 6 feet tall and ~200lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Wisconsinian

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful!
customer_reviews.text: Looks great on my e bike first and foremost. I haven't ridden enough for it to break in fully but I know I'm getting there. Make sure you follow all the written instructions about using the saddle soap prior to use. Great leather and great quality workmanship! No regrets despite having sticker shock originally.
customer_reviews.author: Ellicottvic

customer_reviews.title: It's a beautiful saddle.
customer_reviews.text: Some reviewers complain that the rivets were tarnished when they received the saddle. Copper tarnishes, that's just the way that it is. A few rivets were tarnished when I received it. A dab of Brasso and a little polishing solved that. As far as breaking it in, I'm sticking with proofhide. I didn't shell out this kind of money to soak it in motor oil or bake it in the oven. Proofhide and use will break it in. It's a beautiful saddle.
customer_reviews.author: Chad

customer_reviews.title: Best seat ever
customer_reviews.text: Excellent seat!!! Very comfortable seat and I have tried all kinds of seats. I did two centuries after getting this seat and a few smaller 40/50/60 mile rides as well and my seat area couldn’t be more thankful!!
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Wise

customer_reviews.title: Bolt broke within a few weeks - no tension available
customer_reviews.text: I ordered the B17 aged saddle with great expectations. People have always raved about brooks saddles, and it was comfortable while it lasted (about a week). I weigh under 200 lbs, so I don't think that can be the issue. The front bolt lost all tension within a week and now I basically sink into the seat. I never crashed the bike or anything like that either. I tried to submit a form to brooks a few weeks ago, but there was no response from them. I expected a lot more from the brooks name and will never buy from them again nor recommend to anyone I know.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy it.
customer_reviews.text: I had a perfectly comfortable Schwinn padded seat, but I longed for the leather Brooks saddles I knew since a teen..got one, never knew they made one with a cut out, and brown leather! This is the difference between a sedan car and a sports car, you get the feel of the road with this. I have a small rear, so I need some padding, but this one I can deal with, I put clear shoe pads over the top to make it more comfortable...but it is fine with me either way. Smeared it with leather conditioner too.
customer_reviews.author: Lance A. Taylor

customer_reviews.title: Takes time to break in but worth the money.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brooks B17 Saddle. My first one is still on my commuter bike. The second one is on my mountain bike. It takes a couple of hundred miles to break them in but I have ridden my bikes for hundreds of miles with no problem with soreness. The more you ride with this saddle the better it fits your backside.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: You either love Brooks or hate Brooks
customer_reviews.text: This is far from a new product so there is nothing new to say about it. But getting from Amazon is easy, efficient and good value. If you like Brooks than the B17 is all you want to put on your bike.
customer_reviews.author: zebweb

customer_reviews.title: Satisfying ergonomically and visually.
customer_reviews.text: I have used the saddle for a month now, on several 17 mile rides plus shorter rides, and find it extremely comfortable - so much so that I do not think about my saddle. I ordered this based on having cycled the length of Britain very comfortably on a Brooks B-17 Special saddle (the one with the copper rivets - it is on my other bike), so knew what to expect. I weigh 175 lb. I like the slightly rougher surface of this saddle compared to the regular B-17. The laces are a useful addition to enable adjustment of saddle spread. Construction of the saddle is top-notch, and I expect several decades of use out of it.
customer_reviews.author: Colin J Warren

customer_reviews.title: Slippery
customer_reviews.text: The leather feels like its leathered with butter and made me slip off the seat with every pedal. It would be bad if it had some sort of traction on it and cost half the price
customer_reviews.author: logan stewart

customer_reviews.title: The ideal comfort saddle
customer_reviews.text: Great saddle for long distance comfort. If you first feel it, you will think it is as hard as a brick. But it molds to your sit bones. Eventually it becomes customized to you rear. I can ride miles and arms or wrist or neck may hurt. Rear is great! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Jersey Buyer

customer_reviews.title: Just needs a month of wear
customer_reviews.text: At first it's hard and slippery, but a month of wear and it becomes the only seat i'll ever want. Helped to apply the pomade it came with immediately before an hour long ride, leaving it overnight or whatever served nearly no purpose
customer_reviews.author: David Fryc

customer_reviews.title: Supportive and well made
customer_reviews.text: I've only ridden about 50 single track miles on it so far, but it's the most supportive pedaling platform ever. I can't wait to see what it's like once it breaks in and gets shaped like my a55!
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: A true classic....
customer_reviews.text: This is the same seat that was on my 1980 Fuji S-10-S. Same look, feel and quality. 40 years later! These seats are pure joy. Ultimate craftsmanship and quality. And nothing is s comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: CDM

customer_reviews.title: Supes comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I was advised it could take 200 miles to break this saddle in, but mine has been very comfortable from day one, including two centuries in the first two months. Care is pretty simple, it comes with a small amount of proofride for the initial polish, but it's a good idea to order a small tin and condition the saddle every 3-4 months. This is the most recommended saddle for touring and long-distance rides, gets better with time.
customer_reviews.author: Pete McBride

customer_reviews.title: So far, great!
customer_reviews.text: Still in the break-in period, but it gets more comfortable every ride. I can definitely feel the ride being softened from the seat having some give, almost like suspension. Hoping for many more miles of comfort!
customer_reviews.author: Joe M.

customer_reviews.title: Saddles are subjective and natural materials have variability. I ...
customer_reviews.text: Saddles are subjective and natural materials have variability. I have a b17 standard and prefer it. The leather looks stretched on the narrow after a summers wirth of commuting to work 4-5 days a week, plus errands.... Worth trying, and you can always sell it. Took longer to break in vs my b17 std.
customer_reviews.author: cjs

customer_reviews.title: It's good right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: I was expecting a rough hard ride out of the box. Never happened. Saddle was comfortable from the beginning. Now after some mileage it is amazingly comfortable. Looks good and rides good on my GT aggressor mountain bike.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Riverwalker Thomas

customer_reviews.title: A very comfortable saddle right out of the box.
customer_reviews.text: This is my third Brooks saddle. The existing saddle on my road bike was giving me discomfort, so I purchased the Brooks to replace it. Presto, my discomfort problems were solved. Money well-spent, at a bargain price as well.
customer_reviews.author: A Reader in Virginia

customer_reviews.title: Comfort from the start
customer_reviews.text: Well, I have to say putting on the saddle dressing really helps this seat conform to your back side. I bought a seat in the past with a Brooks saddle on it and it was not comfortable. My buddy bought it off me and dressed it then broke it in for him and he loved it. I dressed this one and have about 20 miles on it. From the first time my backside touched down it was comfortable. Can't wait for the 100 -150 miles break in. So far I'm thinking only Brooks saddles.
customer_reviews.author: DTB

customer_reviews.title: ... only saddle I have ever found that is consistently comfortable. No numbness
customer_reviews.text: I have been ridding for over 40 years and this is the only saddle I have ever found that is consistently comfortable. No numbness, no "bad spots". Many people will advise that the saddle has to be broken in, but I have had two of these and they were both comfortable from day 1. I recently rode the length of the C&O Can Trail on a touring bike with this saddle (i.e. rocks, roots, mud, bumps, etc.). Over the 180 miles, there was never a point where the saddle was uncomfortable - which is saying a lot since the bike has no suspension. 6 Stars if I could give it!!
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: I'm impressed that an otherwise firm saddle can be so comfortable. Being a bigger boy 130kg
customer_reviews.text: While I'm still breaking mine in, I'm impressed that an otherwise firm saddle can be so comfortable. Being a bigger boy 130kg, the width is perfect for my generous kiester. I use this both on my road and MTB. Would recommend the Orange Velo seat post as the rails don't allow for much back travel on the seat post mount.
customer_reviews.author: Solid Scot

customer_reviews.title: the saddle looks good.
customer_reviews.text: Received quickly. Unfortunately saddle was not delivered attached to the typical Brooks cardboard and no spanner wrench was included. Saddle was in a plastic bag with Brooks printed on it, and en envelope with instructions tucked into the rails. No spanner wrench. Other than all that, the saddle looks good.
customer_reviews.author: J. Kanter

customer_reviews.title: The best touring/recreational saddles you’ll find
customer_reviews.text: Brooks saddles are by far the most comfortable saddles on the market. It takes some time to really break these saddles to the point where they really conform to your sitzfleisch, but I’ve always found them comfortable out of the box. Note that Brooks saddles tend to have shorter rails than many other saddles, which can limit fore and aft saddle adjustment. Depending on your bike, you may need to consider changing the seat post to one that offers a larger offset/setback to get the right saddle position (Velo Orange sells a nice one). Well worth it, though, to ride these saddles.
customer_reviews.author: William H. Lowe

customer_reviews.title: As good as I expected
customer_reviews.text: I only needed the Brooks to complete the refurbishing of my 1974 Schwinn Super Sport. I waited a long time hoping for a sale but eventually spent the money. It came as stated and included the 1st application of the Proofide it needs. I am completely satisfied. Some say it requires a long breaking in period, but I haven't noticed it. It was comfortable to me immediately.
customer_reviews.author: KCC

customer_reviews.title: By far the most comfortable road bike seat I have used
customer_reviews.text: This saddle really works for me. By far the most comfortable road bike seat I have used. On long rides, I think less about this seat than any other seat I have had. I use this on my touring bike and my road bike. It is well worth a couple of extra ounces it weights, I have converted to other road bike riders to this seat. Took me about a month for it to fit me.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Twain

customer_reviews.title: However it is not as painful as some may leed you to believe
customer_reviews.text: I have always wanted a Brooks saddle and I look forward to having it broken in. However it is not as painful as some may leed you to believe. I think some folks do not ride all that much and may have, shall we say tender bottoms. It is good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice Saddle
customer_reviews.text: I really don'l know much about bicycle saddles but I do know what is comfortable for me. The saddle that my bicycle came with was very uncomfortable. I hurt to ride the bicycle for any extended distance. It wasn't an inexpensive bicycle. I replaced the saddle with the Brooks and it works like a top. I'm not sore when I finish a long ride. There may be better saddles avaiable but I would be unlikely to give up the Brooks Saddle to try another. I understand the Brooks saddle becomes more comfortable as it breaks in. I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: David Regan

customer_reviews.title: Replaced my furniture
customer_reviews.text: Ive replaced all my couches and chairs in my house with Brooks B17 saddles because they are far more comfortable than anything else I have ever sat on. Do not hesitate to buy one!
customer_reviews.author: Nstar

customer_reviews.title: Great saddle
customer_reviews.text: Beautiful saddle. Came in a very attractive box. Has the large brass rivets and brass rails. I only weigh 140 lbs. These saddles are comfortable for me right out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: Karl L.

customer_reviews.title: Toss it hot water for 5 minutes!
customer_reviews.text: Got this beautiful seat for $70.00 now it is back to $130. Worth every penny, I did a 3 step process of soaking the seat in hot water for 5 minutes. Mink oil and back again, 3 times. The end result in a beautiful seat, leather is soft and a comfortable ride. Alot of the dye came out during this process and I was shocked by beauty at the end. My third Brooks seat, this one is ultra cool!.
customer_reviews.author: John L SullivanNAME_NOT_RETURNED

customer_reviews.title: Not bad at all!
customer_reviews.text: This seat is beginning to grow on me - Me thinks it's still breaking in and it seems to have become more comfortable over time like a lot of people have mentioned. I think I may have 400 to 500 miles on it so far. My butt isn't killing me after my 30 to 40 mile rides.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Too long to break in
customer_reviews.text: After 2000Km it still felt hard as a rock. Not comfortable at all. Also very sensitive to water. The cover sold by brooks wouldn.t protect it at all from the rain. Sold mine and don't regret it.
customer_reviews.author: Felipe A.

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Bigger guy , 6'3" 235lb. Used the "Put it in some water, then go for a ride" trick for break in and it was perfect. got about 600 miles into it now and it's awesome.
customer_reviews.author: M. Morgan

customer_reviews.title: Giddy up
customer_reviews.text: I was a little hesitant with the price of $87 that this could be a knock off. But it looks just like the one I bought at REI. Brooks saddles are for a lifetime. They are the only way to go.
customer_reviews.author: Paul S McCurdy

customer_reviews.title: totally souped up my bike
customer_reviews.text: I love this bike saddle. Mostly because I am vain and it makes my hipster bike look awesome and gives me instant street cred. But also because it's the perfect size for me, and even though it's rock hard (needs awhile to break it in) it's still super comfortable. I'm paranoid about it getting stolen because I live in Brooklyn. But I bought a Master cable gunlock and locked it to the bike. It's perfect, the lock is super light weight, I barely notice.
customer_reviews.author: JuliaChild

customer_reviews.title: A Great classic saddle
customer_reviews.text: So I’ve had this brooks B17 saddle on my cyclocross bike that I use for a commuter for over a year now and I could not be more pleased. I can now ride my bike without having to have padded bike shorts. I even did a ride on the parkway for an hour without problems. A great upgrade worth the hundred or so dollars.
customer_reviews.author: Brent

customer_reviews.title: Looks Good, Feels Good
customer_reviews.text: It is really difficult to justify spending so much money on a bike seat. However, after using the Brooks Saddle for ~4 months on my touring bike, which I use for commuting to work, I am sold on this saddle. I've been comfortable on 50+ mile days with bike shorts. The leather is high quality and provides a low-friction surface. I can definitely see this seat lasting for years with the proper maintenance. The copper looks great, but the only downside is that you have to clean and polish it if you want to keep it from oxidizing. I still think it looks much better than the black rivets would have. Tip of the hat to Brooks. A+
customer_reviews.author: Michael Genovese

customer_reviews.title: Not comfortable
customer_reviews.text: I think people talk themselves into thinking they like this saddle because "everyone else does" and they paid so much for it. Yes it is nicely made, but it is NOT comfortable. Yes I conditioned properly it and rode it hundreds of miles waiting for it to break in. It never did. Wish I could return it.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Billstein

customer_reviews.title: The Best Saddle Period
customer_reviews.text: I find this saddle to be very comfortable even after just 50 miles. In a world where everything is built to fail so that you will buy more, it is nice to buy something made with this kind of craftsmanship that you can expect to use for the rest of your life.
customer_reviews.author: Chad McKee

customer_reviews.title: Rough at first but comfort later
customer_reviews.text: It takes awhile to break these in. I use mine for my bike trainer and long distance rides, in combo with padded bibs. Initially I was highly skeptical, but give it time and it will break in. Maybe 300 miles and it's good
customer_reviews.author: Garth

customer_reviews.title: Nice seat
customer_reviews.text: After a co-worker who rides daily recommend a Brooks saddle to solve my bum bum pain after riding. Read many reviews about them and then bought this one. I proofide the seat and then took my first ride with it. After 7 miles it was feeling better then the old, still breaking it in but no bum bum pain after my ride. Recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Best seat ever.
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat a Brooks. Comfortable right away but will only get better. Got caught out in the rain and no big deal. Just took it home and let it dry then used the Brooks treatment oil. Like new.
customer_reviews.author: Jon Schmitt

customer_reviews.title: Mostly lives up to the hype, but it took ...
customer_reviews.text: Mostly lives up to the hype, but it took a long time to break it in. Unlike most soft saddles, however, I constantly feel the need to tinker with it. Somehow I get cramps in muscles that wouldn't get them before.
customer_reviews.author: XyZ

customer_reviews.title: Awesome!
customer_reviews.text: Best saddle money can buy. Don't be afraid of the break-in period people write about. When brand new, the saddle is no less comfortable than any other. Once broken in, wow! You can spend all day in the saddle.
customer_reviews.author: TJ

customer_reviews.title: Brooks Cult
customer_reviews.text: This is what you'll hear: Brooks saddles are a pain when you first get them. Once you ride 250 miles on one, they become bearable. Once you ride 500 miles on them, it's like another piece of your rear end, perfectly formed after 500 miles. Here's the truth prior to 500 miles: the shaping of the saddle from riding helps a little, but most of the added comfort comes from breaking in your own butt. Will update at 500 miles. That said, branding and good looks, so 4/5.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Best saddle I have used by far!
customer_reviews.text: By far the most comfortable saddle I have used. I thought it needed to be broken it but discovered it was more comfortable WITHOUT padded shorts. Get lots of compliments on the great looks.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Poole

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable From First Ride!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this saddle for my husband as a gift. From first impression of the packaging, I knew the product had to be very high quality. Very nicely presented and indeed the saddle itself is high quality. My husband rides for pleasure and when he received the saddle he immediately put it on his bicycle. It was quick and easy to install. He told me it was comfortable from the first ride. In addition, he really likes the setup for adding a European-style bag. Overall, this saddle should provide many hours of pleasurable, comfortable riding.
customer_reviews.author: J.W.

customer_reviews.title: Do as instructed by “Brooks” and the saddle will brack in just fine!
customer_reviews.text: Did as “Brooks” suggested and “Proofided” it four (4) times before I rode it. Saddle feels so much better than my previous saddle. We liked it so much we’ve bought two (2) more “Brooks” saddles
customer_reviews.author: KCstargazer

customer_reviews.title: COMFORT DELUXE
customer_reviews.text: I bought this saddle hoping it would alleviate a problem of having very sore spots on the inside of my thighs around the crotch area. I was a bit leery of riding too far on it until the break-in period had been met, but I had a 5 day cycling and camping trip planned, so I went ahead and started the trip with it. It worked wonderfully from the first time I used it. I had no problem riding 5 to 8 hour days with no miles on the saddle for break-in. I would highly recommend it as a very comfortable and well made saddle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: First impressions are good. Not much different than the Brooks Team Pro ...
customer_reviews.text: Mmmm hand hammered copper rivets. First impressions are good. Not much different than the Brooks Team Pro I lost. Still needs breaking in. Had a bike stolen that had my first Brooks saddle on it. I immediately bought a new brooks saddle. Love the brooks. Will update as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Beau

customer_reviews.title: it's not broken in yet but out of the box was found to be far more comfortable than the old gel seat it replaced
customer_reviews.text: Recently put a vintage Schwinn hybrid bike bought in the early 90's back on the road (including the rider). Read the reviews on Brooks and found they are as advertised. Sure, it's not broken in yet but out of the box was found to be far more comfortable than the old gel seat it replaced, I did find the B17 Imperial with the cut out in the saddle to be more comfortable. Proofide was purchased and one coat applied, will give it a couple of weeks and apply another coat. Will put more miles on and if I have any observations will come back and update this review.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hard as a rock, slippery as ice....
customer_reviews.text: Hard as a rock, slippery as ice... By far the most comfortable seat I have ever used. I am 57 and about the same amount overweight.... I don't understand it but the seat is awesome. Your backside will thank you... I rode 70 miles this weekend and feel great. Ready for the summer to start.
customer_reviews.author: PQ

customer_reviews.title: Very comfortable seat
customer_reviews.text: Really comfortable seat. Much better than my stock seat. I've put about 200 miles on it with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: C. S. D

customer_reviews.title: One year review!
customer_reviews.text: Great saddle! You can find my full review on YouTube by searching "Brooks saddle review" if you'd like to hear my full thoughts and opinions on this saddle after riding on it for over a year. I've tried 7 or 8 other saddles over the years, and this is the one I've liked and kept the longest. The best part is it just keeps getting more comfortable over time as it breaks in more and more.
customer_reviews.author: Matt Polinski

product_meta.title: Brooks England B17 Bike Saddle - Handmade Leather Bike Seat (Steel, Titanium, Copper)
product_meta.description: The flagship bike seat that Brooks England has been producing for more than 100 years. The durable leather will break in beautifully over time. Steel rails and metal hardware. Leather care kit included.

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
